title: Pokémon Scarlet & Violet: Medali Gym Secret Menu Item Walkthrough

steps.title: Speak to the attendant behind the desk in Medali Gym if you haven't already done so.
steps.content: Speak to the attendant behind the desk in Medali Gym if you haven't already done so. The attendant is a man with black hair and a mustache wearing a suit. The attendant will give you your clue: "Find out how the regulars season their dishes." [1] X Research source If you prefer, you can actually skip this Gym test and jump ahead to the solution . However, you will miss out on experience and reward money from the three trainer battles during the test.

steps.title: Go to the Treasure Eatery.
steps.content: Go to the Treasure Eatery. To get to Treasure Eatery, exit the Gym and go to the right. Turn right at the first street to your right, then run straight ahead. You should see Treasure Eatery, which is a white building with a red awning surrounded by green trees.

steps.title: Enter the Eatery and speak to the man in a suit at the bar.
steps.content: Enter the Eatery and speak to the man in a suit at the bar. When you approach him, his speech bubble says "*munch munch munch*". Ask, Are you a regular here? . The man will reply and give you the answer to your clue, which is lemon .

steps.title: Exit Treasure Eatery.
steps.content: Exit Treasure Eatery. You can now move on to finding the next three clues, which involve finding other trainers. Note that these three clues can be found in any order, so you can skip the exact order presented in this article if you prefer not to!

steps.title: Go straight until you find a trainer with a yellow-outlined speech bubble.
steps.content: Go straight until you find a trainer with a yellow-outlined speech bubble. This trainer, Santiago the Student, is standing next to a girl sitting on a bench next to her Lechonk.

steps.title: Battle Santiago.
steps.content: Battle Santiago. To get Santiago's clue, you must beat him in a Pokémon battle. Santiago's team consists of one level 34 Dunsparce. After you win, Santiago will tell you his clue: "Listen really closely to the blue bird Pokémon."

steps.title: Find the blue bird.
steps.content: Find the blue bird. To do this, turn around and run down the street until you see a person with a blue Squawkabilly sitting on their head.

steps.title: Approach the person and their Squawkabilly.
steps.content: Approach the person and their Squawkabilly. Once you are close to them, the pair will begin talking to you in speech bubbles. After a few lines, the Squawkabilly will say "meedyum", which is highlighted in orange. The answer to this clue is meedyum , or medium .

steps.title: Turn to the left and go down the street.
steps.content: Turn to the left and go down the street. You will pass a trainer on your left standing with a Greedent.

steps.title: Turn right halfway down the street to enter a courtyard.
steps.content: Turn right halfway down the street to enter a courtyard. In the courtyard are tables with red umbrellas.

steps.title: Approach the short girl on the opposite side of the courtyard.
steps.content: Approach the short girl on the opposite side of the courtyard. This girl, Adara the Student, will also have a yellow-outlined speech bubble.

steps.title: Battle Adara.
steps.content: Battle Adara. Her team consists of a level 34 Greedent and a level 34 Gumshoos. After you win, Adara will tell you her clue: "Look for something that's the odd one out at one of the ice cream stands."

steps.title: Go past Adara to the left to the group of food stalls.
steps.content: Go past Adara to the left to the group of food stalls. The ice cream stand is pink, blue, and white, and it is on the right with three balloons.

steps.title: Look at the ice cream stand's shop stock.
steps.content: Look at the ice cream stand's shop stock. Scroll to the bottom to find grilled rice balls, which are definitely out of place at an ice cream stand. The answer to this clue is grilled rice balls .

steps.title: Exit the courtyard.
steps.content: Exit the courtyard. To do this, walk back to Adara, turn right, then go back onto the road.

steps.title: Turn right and continue straight until you find the next trainer.
steps.content: Turn right and continue straight until you find the next trainer. Like the others, this trainer—named Gisela the Student—will have a yellow-outlined speech bubble. She is standing next to a tree on the left-hand side of the road.

steps.title: Battle Gisela.
steps.content: Battle Gisela. Her team consists of a level 34 Ursaring. After you win, Gisela will tell you her clue: "Look for a dark spot surrounded by stairs."

steps.title: Enter the amphitheater behind Gisela.
steps.content: Enter the amphitheater behind Gisela. Go down the stairs to the archway covered with a metal grate.

steps.title: Interact with the archway.
steps.content: Interact with the archway. A text bubble will pop up saying, "What's this…? There's some faint writing here. It says "Fire Blast." The answer to the final clue is Fire Blast .

steps.title: Return to Treasure Eatery.
steps.content: Return to Treasure Eatery. To do this, exit the amphitheater. In the opening between the cafe and the sandwich shop, you will see Treasure Eatery.

steps.title: Speak to the worker with a green apron.
steps.content: Speak to the worker with a green apron. This worker is standing near the front door of the restaurant, off to the right.

steps.title: Order the secret menu item.
steps.content: Order the secret menu item. Enter the clues you found in this order: Grilled rice balls Medium serving Extra crispy, Fire Blast style Lemon The Treasure Eatery will turn into the arena for the Gym battle. Speak to the worker with the green apron again to start the Gym challenge.
